alert.note: Alert for Eastern Sawatch Mountains above 11000 Ft; Gore and Elk Mountains, Central Mountain Valleys; West Elk and Sawatch Mountains; Western Chaffee County Between 9000 and 11000 Ft; Western Mosquito Range, East Lake County Above 11000 Ft (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Avalanche Warning issued January 17 at 3:26PM MST by NWS Boulder
info.description: THE FOLLOWING MESSAGE IS TRANSMITTED AT THE REQUEST OF THE COLORADO AVALANCHE INFORMATION CENTER. ...AVALANCHE WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM WEDNESDAY UNTIL 5 PM THURSDAY... * WHAT...The Avalanche Danger will be HIGH (Level 4 of 5) on Thursday. * WHERE...Elk Mountain, Ruby Range, Mosquito Range, Sawatch Range. * WHEN...In effect from 5 PM Wednesday, January 17 until 5 PM on Thursday, January 18 * IMPACTS...Heavy snow and strong winds have created dangerous avalanche conditions in the backcountry. Large and dangerous avalanches will be very easy to trigger. Avalanches will run naturally. ...PRECAUTION/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS...Travel in backcountry avalanche terrain is not recommended. Avoid travel on and under slopes steeper than about 30 degrees. You can find more detailed information at colorado.gov/avalanche Lazar

area.areaDesc: Eastern Sawatch Mountains above 11000 Ft; Gore and Elk Mountains, Central Mountain Valleys; West Elk and Sawatch Mountains; Western Chaffee County Between 9000 and 11000 Ft; Western Mosquito Range, East Lake County Above 11000 Ft
